content:
The baking soda and vinegar method is a great choice! It's a natural, non-toxic, and environmentally friendly way to remove soap scum and other stains. It's also a gentle method that won't damage most surfaces.

Since you've had good luck with it in the past, you can definitely try it again for your shower. Just remember to mix the baking soda and vinegar to form a paste, apply it to the soap scum stain, and let it sit for about 30 minutes to allow the mixture to work its magic.

After 30 minutes, scrub the area gently with a non-abrasive sponge or cloth, and then rinse with warm water. You might need to repeat the process a few times to completely remove the soap scum, but it's worth it for the effective and eco-friendly results.

By the way, I'm glad to hear that you cleaned your bathroom sink last weekend! Keeping your bathroom clean and tidy can really make a big difference in the overall ambiance and hygiene of the space.

If you have any more questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask!
